Action.author: dhuseby
Action.body: This needs to be confirmed. Validating all input is a commandment of secure programming, so this needs to be fixed. It's severity level seems to be fairly low to me and doesn't warrant an advisory since it is mostly an insider attack vector.

Action.author: dhuseby
Action.body: This is a high security bug that hasn't been touched since the end of November. What's going on with this?

Action.author: dhuseby
Action.body: I'm OK with downgrading this bug per your comment. My only concern is that with #1 you're basically saying that all operators will have to have the capability of inspecting the chaincode source code and making sense of it. I could think of a consortium situation where one member recommends installing an updated chaincode and all of the other members just blindly install it. I guess we can't fix user error. Maybe we need to make sure the end user is aware of the danger of running un-reviewed chaincode.

Action.author: dhuseby
Action.body: Gari, I'm not sure you addressed the bug as described, unless I don't fully grok the report. It sounds to me like an unvalidated path bug. Are you saying that the path will have to point to a signed chaincode bundle for anything to actually be installed/run?
